intro: Spermacoce thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved rattlebox, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often fragrant and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions in Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Spermacoce thymifolia is often found in open woodlands and along rocky outcrops.
